text:
In docs/manual/CoreTypes/filterchain.html, the paragraph that precedes the 
first example for replacetokens, @DATE@ is replaced by the date I built Ant.  
Specifically, instead of :  
  
    This replaces occurences of the string @DATE@ in the data  
  
I get:  
  
    This replaces occurences of the string July 12 2002 in the data 
 
  The online documentation doesn't suffer from this problem.  My build from 
the 1.5 source was a straightforward invocation of the build.sh script as per 
the documentation.
creator: smileyjonathan@yahoo.com.au

text:
I notice you used lowercase (@date@) for the other occurences in the 
documentation.  I'd prefer to see the documentation reflect what people tend 
to do, which is put the token name in uppercase (@DATE@). 
 
  If the text processing you run over the documentation source doesn't support 
quoting of @ symbols, try using an HTML character reference instead of one of 
the @ characters e.g. @DATE@ or @DATE@  The first of these two 
examples looks clearer to me, but that's just my opinion.
creator: smileyjonathan@yahoo.com.au

text: In the confirmation mail I just received it looks like bugzilla may have  translated the HTML character references in my previous additional comment  into ASCII.  The examples should be like this (without the spaces between each character):      & # 6 4 ; D A T E @   @ D A T E & # 6 4 ;
